name: Slow Cooker Hot Buttered Apples
description: Slow Cooker Hot Buttered Apples are an easy and versatile dessert that is perfect for using up your glut of autumn apples!

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and slice the apples, then place them in a slow cooker (4 quart or larger). Add the lemon juice, brown sugar, cinnamon, cloves, vanilla, salt, and cornstarch to the slow cooker, then stir to coat the apples in the spices.
recipeInstructions.name: Peel and slice the apples, then place them in a slow cooker (4 quart or larger). Add the lemon juice, brown sugar, cinnamon, cloves, vanilla, salt, and cornstarch to the slow cooker, then stir to coat the apples in the spices.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide the butter into pieces, then place the butter on top of the seasoned apples. Pour 1/2 cup water into the cooker down the side so that reaches the bottom without rinsing the spices from the apples.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide the butter into pieces, then place the butter on top of the seasoned apples. Pour 1/2 cup water into the cooker down the side so that reaches the bottom without rinsing the spices from the apples.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the lid on the slow cooker, set it to high heat, and cook for two hours. After two hours, stir the apples well, replace the lid, and cook for an additional one hour, then serve hot.

review.reviewBody: Thanks for a great way to use the apples that are falling in abundance from my tree. Delicious recipe! So versatile too. I love it!

Good recipe! Only gave 4 stars because mine was like applesauce before the three hours was up. Also possibly my fault. I only had about 8 apples instead of 12. Wished I had realized sooner that they might not need the whole 3. Maybe I should have stopped at 2 hours. They did seem soft then. Or perhaps I just cut them too thinly? Or my crockpot just runs hotter? Either way the flavor on my 'applesauce' was good. I had a little with ice cream. Need to try stirring it into oatmeal tomorrow. I'll probably be back to try this one again sometime.
I have fixed this recipe multiple times for my family and now it's probably the most requested item I cook.
